verses.kjv: Nevertheless the dimness shall not be such as was in her vexation, when at the first he lightly afflicted the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, and afterward did more grievously afflict her by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, in Galilee of the nations.
verses.ct: Still, the gloom will not last for those who were in distress. In earlier times, God humbled the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, but in the future he will bring honor to the road along the sea, the region beyond the Jordan, and Galilee of the nations.

verses.kjv: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light: they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.
verses.ct: The people who walked in darkness have seen a brilliant light. For those living in a land overshadowed by death, a light has broken through and shone on them.

verses.kjv: Thou hast multiplied the nation, and not increased the joy: they joy before thee according to the joy in harvest, and as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.
verses.ct: You have expanded the nation and increased their joy. They celebrate in your presence the way people celebrate at harvest time, like warriors who are thrilled as they divide up what they've captured.

verses.kjv: For thou hast broken the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor, as in the day of Midian.
verses.ct: Because you have shattered the yoke that burdened them, the bar across their shoulders, and the rod of the one who oppressed them — just as you did on the day Midian was defeated.

verses.kjv: For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise, and garments rolled in blood; but this shall be with burning and fuel of fire.
verses.ct: Every boot that stomped in battle and every uniform soaked in blood will be thrown into the fire and burned up as fuel.

verses.kjv: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given: and the government shall be upon his shoulder: and his name shall be called Wonderful, Counsellor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.
verses.ct: A child has been born for us, a son has been given to us. The authority to rule will rest on his shoulders, and he will be called Wonderful, Counselor, The Mighty God, The Everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.

verses.kjv: Of the increase of his government and peace there shall be no end, upon the throne of David, and upon his kingdom, to order it, and to establish it with judgment and with justice from henceforth even for ever. The zeal of the LORD of hosts will perform this.
verses.ct: His rule and his peace will expand without end. He will reign on David's throne and over his kingdom, establishing it and sustaining it with justice and righteousness from that time forward and forever. The passionate commitment of the LORD of Hosts will accomplish this.

verses.kjv: The Lord sent a word into Jacob, and it hath lighted upon Israel.
verses.ct: The Lord sent a message against Jacob, and it landed squarely on Israel.

verses.kjv: And all the people shall know, even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria, that say in the pride and stoutness of heart,
verses.ct: All the people will know it — Ephraim and the residents of Samaria — who say with arrogance and stubborn pride,

verses.kjv: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones: the sycomores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.
verses.ct: 'The brick buildings have collapsed, but we'll rebuild with cut stone. The sycamore trees have been chopped down, but we'll replace them with cedars.'

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together;
verses.ct: So the LORD will strengthen Rezin's enemies against Israel and stir up all his foes at once.

verses.kjv: The Syrians before, and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.ct: The Arameans from the east and the Philistines from the west will devour Israel with wide-open mouths. Even after all this, his anger has not subsided, and his hand is still raised to strike.

verses.kjv: For the people turneth not unto him that smiteth them, neither do they seek the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: Yet the people have not turned back to the one who struck them, and they have not sought the LORD of Hosts.

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD will cut off from Israel head and tail, branch and rush, in one day.
verses.ct: So the LORD will cut off from Israel both head and tail, both palm branch and reed, in a single day.

verses.kjv: The ancient and honourable, he is the head; and the prophet that teacheth lies, he is the tail.
verses.ct: The elders and prominent leaders are the head, and the prophets who teach lies are the tail.

verses.kjv: For the leaders of this people cause them to err; and they that are led of them are destroyed.
verses.ct: Those who guide this people have led them astray, and those who follow their guidance are swallowed up.

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD shall have no joy in their young men, neither shall have mercy on their fatherless and widows: for every one is an hypocrite and an evildoer, and every mouth speaketh folly. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.ct: That is why the Lord will take no pleasure in their young men and will show no mercy to their orphans and widows. Every one of them is godless and does evil, and every mouth speaks foolishness. Even after all this, his anger has not subsided, and his hand is still raised to strike.

verses.kjv: For wickedness burneth as the fire: it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forest, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.
verses.ct: Wickedness burns like a fire — it consumes thorns and briers, then ignites the dense forest, and the flames spiral upward in columns of smoke.

verses.kjv: Through the wrath of the LORD of hosts is the land darkened, and the people shall be as the fuel of the fire: no man shall spare his brother.
verses.ct: Because of the fury of the LORD of Hosts, the land is scorched, and the people serve as fuel for the fire. No one shows mercy to his own brother.

verses.kjv: And he shall snatch on the right hand, and be hungry; and he shall eat on the left hand, and they shall not be satisfied: they shall eat every man the flesh of his own arm:
verses.ct: People grab food on the right but are still starving; they eat on the left but are never satisfied. Each one ends up devouring the flesh of his own family:

verses.kjv: Manasseh, Ephraim; and Ephraim, Manasseh: and they together shall be against Judah. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.ct: Manasseh turns against Ephraim, and Ephraim against Manasseh, and together they attack Judah. Even after all this, his anger has not subsided, and his hand is still raised to strike.
